greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of the rational number obtained when exponents in prime factorization of n are reinterpreted as alternating binary sums (A065620).
comment: Map n -> A270418(n)/A270419(n) is a bijection from N (1, 2, 3, ...) to the set of positive rationals.
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^A065620(e) for odious e, a(p^e)=1 for evil e, or equally, a(p^e) = p^(A010060(e)*A065620(e)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..12167
xref: Cf. also A270420, A270421, A270436, A270437 and permutation pair A273671/A273672.
Differs from A056192 for the first time at n=32, which here a(32)=1, while A056192(32)=4.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 23 2016
